title: South African Markets - Factors to watch on Sept. 18
text:

SOUTH AFRICAN MARKETS

South Africa's rand extended its losses on Tuesday to a one-week low as heightened tensions in the Middle East after the weekend attack on Saudi Arabia's facilities soured risk demand globally.

In equities, stocks weakened with the broader All-share index .JALSH down 1.66% to 56,895 points, while the benchmark Top-40 index .JTOPI declined 1.79% to 50,873 points. .J ZAR/

GLOBAL MARKETS

Oil prices cooled on Wednesday as Saudi Arabia said full oil production would be restored by month's end while caution ahead of an expected U.S. interest rate cut kept wider financial markets in tight ranges. MKTS/GLOB

WALL STREET

Wall Street ended higher on Tuesday as the impact of weekend attacks on Saudi Arabia's biggest oil refinery faded and investors awaited a widely expected Fed interest rate cut on Wednesday. .N

GOLD

Gold prices were little changed on Wednesday amid cautious mood as investors awaited cues on the U.S. central bank's stance on monetary easing, while a drop in crude prices dented demand for safe-haven bullion. GOL/
